div.h2: Welcome to Kings River Union Elementary

div.p: Independent Learning Resources
Support Resources for Students & Families

Kings River Union Elementary School District exists to empower all students to achieve their highest potential
to become responsible, productive members of society through the highest standards of education.
Schedule a tour of our campus

I’m sure the 5 tips for elementary students from a teacher that are posted below will come in handy some day. You might not use them all right now, but I bet you remember one or two later on and they end up helping you out.

Saying ‘please’ and ‘thank you’ can also be done in the classroom. Teachers like to hear these words as much as your parents, grandparents, and other family members do. Being polite is something that should be done all the time and not only when you want something. Show respect to friends and they will be respectful to you as well. Good manners are always a nice trait to have!

div.h5: Tip 2: Listen very carefully to instructions
div.p: Teachers give instructions for assignments and so you know what to do in class at different times of the day. Listening closely to what these instructions are not only makes your teacher’s job easier, but then you don’t need to ask for the same instructions later on. You just might miss out on something important by not listening carefully to what is being told to you. If you think you’ve missed something, look around to see what other people are doing or ask a friend.

div.h5: Tip 3: Try to remember to use an outdoor voice outside only
div.p: Things get exciting in the classroom at times and you might be happy about something that happened over the weekend, but you still need to remember to not yell out in the classroom. When one person begins to talk loud, someone else talks a bit louder, and this chain continues until the entire room is filled with loud voices. Help your teacher out by whispering or talking low enough for only your friend to hear when you have something to tell him or her.

div.h5: Tip 4: Return items that aren’t yours
div.p: When you notice that a classmate has dropped something, but doesn’t realize that this happened, pick it up and hand it to them. If you lost something and a friend found it, wouldn’t you want your item returned to you? I know I would be thrilled that my friend cared enough to return something that I had lost. You might find an item and not know who it belongs to. Ask around or give it to the teacher.

Neatness counts for a lot in the classroom. If your desk is organized, then you will be able to find pencils, crayons, and even assignments. A messy desk is where assignments get lost, torn, and they have even been known to completely disappear. When a friend needs to borrow a pencil or asks to use a piece of paper, having an orderly desk will allow you to find what is needed to help out this friend.
Stay up to date and informed with Kings River Union Elementary.
Keep up with our active KRUE!
Don’t miss the bus! Click here for info.
KRUE exists to empower all students…..
The Kings River School District Story

div.div:
5
Parent Center Stay on the information wagon at KRUE

div.p: Meet the Admin Staff at KRUE
Need to contact a teacher? Click here!
Meetings, Agendas & more…

The Living Wax Museum is our end of the year project in fifth grade. Students are asked to choose a historical figure that they would like to learn more about. We give them a timeline of 1500-1850 (we do make exceptions to this rule if they are interested in someone outside of these dates). Students are required to write an informational report about the person they chose, come up with a costume, and be prepared to present an overview of their figure, in the first person, the day of the museum presentation.
Our after-school Pioneer Cheerleaders battled 16 teams and earned a 3rd place win in the CHOICES Cheerleading competition last week.
Congratulations Cheer Squad Team…keep up the great work!!

Finally after months of work the new KingsRiverElementary.org website is up and running! We are still adding articles and features to the site but with updated school and district information that parents, teachers and students need you’re sure to find what you are looking for easily. Plus, we will be showcasing everything that’s great about being a KRUE Pioneer! So when you have time spend some time reviewing the new site and give us your feedback. And don’t forget to check back regularly for What’s New with KRUE!!
3961 Avenue 400 Kingsburg, CA 93631
Kings River Union Elementary © 2017 | Powered my Integrative Brand Management
